location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Secret Letters received, by way of Marseilles, May 18. 1857.’

mods.abstract: This bundle consists of summaries of official secret letters received, from the Governor General of India in Council (8 April 1857, Numbers 16-17), and from Bombay [presumably the Government of Bombay] (16 April 1857, Numbers 80-87).The summaries of the letters from the Governor General acknowledge the receipt of previous letters, and also relate to the arrival of the small force sent to China [to Hong Kong?] from Singapore. The summaries of the letters from Bombay mostly concern Persia, including troop movements as a result of the Treaty between Great Britain and Persia.

name.namePart: Viceroy and Governor-General of India in Council
